io

Class LogStreamManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.LogStreamManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CommunicatorListener

    public class LogStreamManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements CommunicatorListener
    A LogStreamManager handles communication between processes, components, and the OS file system.
    Author:
    Richard

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean PRETTY_PRINTING
      Set to true to enable human readable printing of log files.

    • Field Detail

      • PRETTY_PRINTING

        public boolean PRETTY_PRINTING
        Set to true to enable human readable printing of log files. false by default to increase performance.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LogStreamManager

        public LogStreamManager()
        Creates a new LogStreamManager.

      • LogStreamManager

        public LogStreamManager(boolean suppressIncoming)
        Creates a new LogStreamManager.
        Parameters:
        suppressIncoming - If true, most incoming messages will be ignored.

        Read a log file from the file specified by filePath.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the log was successfully read. false otherwise.

      • readLog

        public boolean readLog(java.io.File logFile)
        Read, unwrap and store data from a JSON log file.
        Parameters:
        logFile - The file to read.
        Returns:
        true if the log was successfully read. false otherwise.

      • getCommunicator

        public Communicator getCommunicator()
        Returns the Communicator used by this LogStreamManager.
        Returns:
        The Communicator used by this LogStreamManager.

      • printLogAutoName

        public void printLogAutoName(java.io.File targetDir)
        Print the operations and header information currently held by this LogStreamManager. Set the public variable PRETTY_PRINTING to true to enable human-readable output. Will generate a filename automatically on the form YY-MM-DD_HHMMSS.
        Parameters:
        targetDir - The directory to print the log file.

      • printLog

        public void printLog(java.io.File target)
        Print the operations and header information currently held by this LogStreamManager. Set the public variable PRETTY_PRINTING to true to enable human-readable output. Will generate a filename automatically on the form YY-MM-DD_HHMMSS.
        Parameters:
        target - The location and file name of the file to print.

      • printLog

        public void printLog(java.lang.String targetPath,
                     boolean autoName)
        Print the operations and header information currently held by this LogStreamManager. Set the public variable PRETTY_PRINTING to true to enable human-readable output. If autoName is true, a file name on the form "YY-MM-DD_HHMMSS.oi" will be generated.
        Parameters:
        targetPath - The location to print the log file.
        autoName - If true file name will be created automatically.

      • streamLogData

        public boolean streamLogData()
        Stream the data held by this LogStreamManager using the current Communicator.
        Returns:
        True if data was successfully streamed.

      • streamAndClearLogData

        public boolean streamAndClearLogData()
        Stream the data held by this LogStreamManager using the current Communicator, then clear data. Data will be cleared only if successful (this method returns true).
        Returns:
        True if data was successfully streamed.

      • stream

        public boolean stream(Wrapper wrapper)
        Stream the given Wrapper using the Communicator carried by this LogStreamManager.
        Parameters:
        wrapper - The Wrapper to stream.
        Returns:
        True if successful, false otherwise.

      • stream

        public boolean stream(Operation operation)
        Stream the given Wrapper using the Communicator carried by this LogStreamManager.
        Parameters:
        operation - The Operation to stream.
        Returns:
        True if successful, false otherwise.

      • stream

        public boolean stream(java.lang.String JSONString)
        Stream the given JSON string using the Communicator carried by this LogStreamManager.
        Parameters:
        JSONString - The String to stream.
        Returns:
        True if successful, false otherwise.

      • streamOperations

        public boolean streamOperations(java.util.List<Operation> operations)
        Stream the given Operation list using the Communicator carried by this LogStreamManager.
        Parameters:
        operations - The operations to stream.
        Returns:
        True if successful, false otherwise.

      • stream

        public boolean stream(AnnotatedVariable annotatedVariable)
        Stream the given AnnotatedVariable using the Communicator carried by this LogStreamManager.
        Parameters:
        annotatedVariable - The Wrapper to stream.
        Returns:
        True if successful, false otherwise.

      • streamWrappers

        public boolean streamWrappers(java.util.List<Wrapper> wrappers)
        Stream the given Wrapper using the Communicator carried by this LogStreamManager.
        Parameters:
        wrappers - The Wrappers to stream.
        Returns:
        True if ALL wrappers successfully sent, false otherwise.

      • printSimpleLog

        public void printSimpleLog(java.lang.String targetPath)

      • printSimpleLog

        public void printSimpleLog(java.lang.String targetPath,
                           Wrapper wrapper)

      • printLog

        public void printLog(java.lang.String targetPath,
                     Wrapper wrapper,
                     boolean addName)
        Print the operations and header container in the wrapper given as argument. Set the public variable PRETTY_PRINTING to true to enable human-readable output.
        Parameters:
        targetPath - The location to print the log file.
        wrapper - The wrapper to convert into a log file.
        addName - if true, a name will be automatically generated.

        Description copied from interface: CommunicatorListener

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        messageType - The type of message received.

      • clearData

        public void clearData()
        Clear list of operations and known variables. Equivalent to calling clearOperations() and clearKnownVariables().
